pageContext.description: Late Bronze age copper alloy socketed axe (Type Meldreth) with a double mouth and a trumpet-shaped collar (Schmidt & Burgess, 1981, 205, no.1214). The body is slender and straight with an expanded blade and a loop that extends from the second, shallow mouth ridge. The surface condition of the axe is poor with one broken blade corner. The back is coated with mud while the red /brown skin on the front is worn and corroded. These areas of broken skin are porous and matte green.
pageContext.notes: Part of the Rothley Hoard other items can be found at LEIC-A67B11 LEIC-A665D7 and LEIC-A6BB51
pageContext.subsequentActionTerm: Acquired by museum after being declared Treasure
